1.author: Kin Hubbard
1.quote: Nobody ever forgets where he buried the hatchet.

2.author: Don Marquis
2.quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: 'Whose?'

3.author: Sean O'Casey
3.quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.

4.author: James Joyce
4.quote: Christopher Columbus, as everyone knows, is honored by posterity because he was the last to discover America.

5.author: Les Dawson
5.quote: I used to sell furniture for a living. The trouble was, it was my own.

7.author: Sinclair Lewis
7.quote: People will buy anything that is 'one to a customer.'

8.author: Jackie Kennedy
8.quote: A camel makes an elephant feel like a jet plane.

9.author: Rodney Dangerfield
9.quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.

10.author: Jules Renard
10.quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.

11.author: Samuel Goldwyn
11.quote: A wide screen just makes a bad film twice as bad.

12.author: Saul Bellow
12.quote: When we ask for advice, we are usually looking for an accomplice.

13.author: Garry Shandling
13.quote: I'm dating a woman now who, evidently, is unaware of it.

14.author: Will Rogers
14.quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.

15.author: Lily Tomlin
15.quote: I personally think we developed language because of our deep need to complain.

16.author: Groucho Marx
16.quote: A hospital bed is a parked taxi with the meter running.

17.author: George Burns
17.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.

18.author: Peter Drucker
18.quote: Most of what we call management consists of making it difficult for people to get their work done.

19.author: Spike Milligan
19.quote: All I ask is the chance to prove that money can't make me happy.

20.author: Samuel Johnson
20.quote: Bachelors have consciences, married men have wives.

21.author: A. J. Liebling
21.quote: An Englishman teaching an American about food is like the blind leading the one-eyed.

23.author: Marshall McLuhan
23.quote: I don't necessarily agree with everything I say.

24.author: Herbert Hoover
24.quote: All men are equal before fish.

25.author: James Thurber
25.quote: Why do you have to be a nonconformist like everybody else?

26.author: Rodney Dangerfield
26.quote: On Halloween, the parents sent their kids out looking like me.

27.author: Bette Davis
27.quote: I'd like to kiss ya, but I just washed my hair.

29.author: Mark Twain
29.quote: Suppose you were an idiot, and suppose you were a member of Congress; but I repeat myself.

30.author: Charles Kettering
30.quote: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.

31.author: Rudyard Kipling
31.quote: All the people like us are we, and everyone else is They.

32.author: Aristophanes
32.quote: Under every stone lurks a politician.

33.author: Kin Hubbard
33.quote: We would all like to vote for the best man but he is never a candidate.

34.author: Winston Churchill
34.quote: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.

35.author: Henny Youngman
35.quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.

36.author: Wernher von Braun
36.quote: Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.

37.author: Ken Kesey
37.quote: The trouble with super heroes is what to do between phone booths.

38.author: Sylvia Plath
38.quote: There must be quite a few things that a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them.

39.author: Bob Hope
39.quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.

40.author: Mae West
40.quote: Too much of a good thing can be taxing.

41.author: Franklin P. Jones
41.quote: Scratch a dog and you'll find a permanent job.

42.author: Phyllis Diller
42.quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.

43.author: Logan Pearsall Smith
43.quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.

44.author: Mignon McLaughlin
44.quote: There are a handful of people whom money won't spoil, and we all count ourselves among them.

45.author: Rita Rudner
45.quote: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.

47.author: Earl Wilson
47.quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.

48.author: Dick Cavett
48.quote: If your parents never had children, chances are... neither will you.

49.author: Thor Heyerdahl
49.quote: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity.

50.author: Kevin James
50.quote: Thanksgiving, man. Not a good day to be my pants.

51.author: Joan Collins
51.quote: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.

52.author: Clint Eastwood
52.quote: If you want a guarantee, buy a toaster.

53.author: Irv Kupcinet
53.quote: An optimist is a person who starts a new diet on Thanksgiving Day.

54.author: Jim Davis
54.quote: Vegetables are a must on a diet. I suggest carrot cake, zucchini bread, and pumpkin pie.

55.author: Yogi Berra
55.quote: A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore.

56.author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
56.quote: I am a marvelous housekeeper. Every time I leave a man I keep his house.

57.author: Calvin Trillin
57.quote: As far as I'm concerned, 'whom' is a word that was invented to make everyone sound like a butler.

58.author: Charles Kettering
58.quote: Thinking is one thing no one has ever been able to tax.

59.author: Andy Warhol
59.quote: I am a deeply superficial person.

60.author: H. L. Mencken
60.quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.

61.author: John F. Kennedy
61.quote: My brother Bob doesn't want to be in government - he promised Dad he'd go straight.

63.author: Fran Lebowitz
63.quote: Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep.

64.author: Lily Tomlin
64.quote: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.

65.author: Christopher Morley
65.quote: We've had bad luck with our kids - they've all grown up.

66.author: Yogi Berra
66.quote: You wouldn't have won if we'd beaten you.

67.author: Arthur C. Clarke
67.quote: The best measure of a man's honesty isn't his income tax return. It's the zero adjust on his bathroom scale.

68.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
68.quote: First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you.

69.author: Ernest Hemingway
69.quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.

70.author: E. B. White
70.quote: I see nothing in space as promising as the view from a Ferris wheel.

71.author: Phil McGraw
71.quote: A year from now, you're gonna weigh more or less than what you do right now.

72.author: Bob Dole
72.quote: The internet is a great way to get on the net.

73.author: Johnny Carson
73.quote: Mail your packages early so the post office can lose them in time for Christmas.

74.author: Vince Lombardi
74.quote: We didn't lose the game; we just ran out of time.

75.author: P. J. O'Rourke
75.quote: Always read something that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.

76.author: J. Paul Getty
76.quote: The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.

77.author: Robert Frost
77.quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.

78.author: Alfred Adler
78.quote: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.

79.author: W. C. Fields
79.quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.

80.author: Victor Borge
80.quote: Santa Claus has the right idea - visit people only once a year.

81.author: Jerome K. Jerome
81.quote: What I am looking for is a blessing not in disguise.

82.author: Phyllis McGinley
82.quote: Please to put a nickel, please to put a dime. How petitions trickle in at Christmas time!

83.author: Erma Bombeck
83.quote: I come from a family where gravy is considered a beverage.

84.author: Ellen DeGeneres
84.quote: Nothing says holidays, like a cheese log.

85.author: Frances Wright
85.quote: Pets, like their owners, tend to expand a little over the Christmas period.

86.author: Samuel Pepys
86.quote: Strange to see how a good dinner and feasting reconciles everybody.

87.author: Charles M. Schulz
87.quote: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It is already tomorrow in Australia.

88.author: Bill Vaughan
88.quote: Youth is when you're allowed to stay up late on New Year's Eve. Middle age is when you're forced to.

89.author: Warren Buffett
89.quote: I buy expensive suits. They just look cheap on me.

90.author: Abraham Lincoln
90.quote: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?

91.author: Mae West
91.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.

92.author: Josh Billings
92.quote: There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory.

93.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
93.quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.

94.author: Clarence Darrow
94.quote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President; I'm beginning to believe it.

95.author: Joseph Addison
95.quote: Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.

96.author: Mary Pickford
96.quote: Adding sound to movies would be like putting lipstick on the Venus de Milo.

97.author: Lenny Bruce
97.quote: Miami Beach is where neon goes to die.

98.author: Truman Capote
98.quote: Venice is like eating an entire box of chocolate liqueurs in one go.

99.author: John F. Kennedy
99.quote: The pay is good and I can walk to work.

100.author: H. L. Mencken
100.quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.

101.author: George Burns
101.quote: I spent a year in that town, one Sunday.

102.author: Ogden Nash
102.quote: Progress might have been alright once, but it has gone on too long.

103.author: W. C. Fields
103.quote: A woman drove me to drink and I didn't even have the decency to thank her.

105.author: Groucho Marx
105.quote: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.

106.author: Jay Leno
106.quote: The reason there are two senators for each state is so that one can be the designated driver.

107.author: Jimmy Buffett
107.quote: Indecision may or may not be my problem.

108.author: Ted Turner
108.quote: Sports is like a war without the killing.

110.author: P. J. O'Rourke
110.quote: Never wear anything that panics the cat.

111.author: Joan Crawford
111.quote: I, Joan Crawford, I believe in the dollar. Everything I earn, I spend.

112.author: Princess Margaret
112.quote: I have as much privacy as a goldfish in a bowl.

113.author: Emo Philips
113.quote: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.

114.author: Bob Hope
114.quote: I don't feel old. I don't feel anything till noon. That's when it's time for my nap.

115.author: Niels Bohr
115.quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially if it's about the future.

116.author: Rita Rudner
116.quote: When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always.

117.author: Gilda Radner
117.quote: I base most of my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.

118.author: Gertrude Stein
118.quote: There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. That's the answer.

119.author: Samuel Beckett
119.quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.

120.author: Douglas Adams
120.quote: I don't believe it. Prove it to me and I still won't believe it.

121.author: Benjamin Disraeli
121.quote: As for our majority... one is enough.

122.author: Mark Twain
122.quote: I didn't attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.

123.author: Oscar Wilde
123.quote: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.

124.author: Jean-Luc Godard
124.quote: To be or not to be. That's not really a question.

125.author: Albert Einstein
125.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.

126.author: Sophia Loren
126.quote: Spaghetti can be eaten most successfully if you inhale it like a vacuum cleaner.

127.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
127.quote: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people's luck.

128.author: Emo Philips
128.quote: I was sleeping the other night, alone, thanks to the exterminator.

129.author: George Burns
129.quote: At my age flowers scare me.

130.author: Henny Youngman
130.quote: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.

131.author: Wendy Liebman
131.quote: I've been on so many blind dates, I should get a free dog.

132.author: Lily Tomlin
132.quote: If love is the answer, could you please rephrase the question?

133.author: Alfred Hitchcock
133.quote: A good film is when the price of the dinner, the theatre admission and the babysitter were worth it.

134.author: Clint Eastwood
134.quote: There's only one way to have a happy marriage and as soon as I learn what it is I'll get married again.
